title: Former French President Jacques Chirac dies aged 86
text:
Former French President Jacques Chirac | Philippe Desmazes/AFP via Getty Images Former French President Jacques Chirac dies aged 86 Chirac served as president, prime minister and Paris mayor in one of France’s longest political careers.

Former French President Jacques Chirac has died in Paris aged 86.

"President Jacques Chirac has died this morning among his own. Peacefully," his son-in-law told Agence France-Presse on Thursday.

In one of France's longest political careers, Chirac held the country's most powerful office for 12 years, from 1995 to 2007, and served as prime minister twice. He also was a member of the country's parliament, the mayor of Paris and founded the conservative party now known as Les Républicains.

It was during Chirac's presidency that France refused to join the U.S. in the Iraq war in 2003 and French citizens rejected the treaty establishing a constitution for the EU in a 2005 referendum.

“War is always a last resort. It is always proof of failure. It is always the worst of solutions, because it brings death and misery,” he said a week before the U.S.-led coalition forces invaded Iraq.

In 2011, the former president was given a two-year suspended prison sentence for embezzling public funds. In his final years, he was suffering from a neurological illness and was rarely seen in public.

The French National Assembly observed a minute's silence in his memory.

President Emmanuel Macron is expected to speak on television Thursday evening to pay tribute to his late predecessor.

Another former French president, François Hollande, paid homage to Chirac by saying "I know that today, the French people, whatever their convictions, have just lost a friend."

Jean-Claude Juncker, the president of the European Commission, also paid tribute, saying Europe had lost "a great statesman" and he had lost "a great friend."

Former U.K. Prime Minister Tony Blair said in a statement: “I am deeply saddened by the passing of Jacques Chirac. He was a towering figure in French and European politics over many decades. Whatever our differences from time to time, he was always unfailingly kind, generous and personally supportive."

Blair added: “I always respected his forthright expression of views and I always felt his deep love and passion for France and the French people.”

Belgian MEP and former Prime Minister Guy Verhofstadt said: "When we discussed tough issues, his humor always brought a sense of relief. But it is especially his attachment to the European project that turned him into the real statesman that we will miss."
description: Chirac served as president, prime minister and Paris mayor in one of France’s longest political careers.
